intro: Asteroschoenus speciosus, commonly known as the ornate star-sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species in wetland ecosystems. The ornate star-sedge is also valued for its ornamental appeal in horticultural settings.
